definition: a natural stream of water of usually considerable volume
watercourse

something resembling a river                                      
             
             a river of lava

large or overwhelming quantities

to or in prison                                      
             
             was sent up the river
a large natural flow of water that crosses an area of land and goes into an ocean, a lake, etc.
a large flow of something
a natural stream of water larger than a brook or creek

a large stream or flow

definition: a large area of water that flows towards the sea
a large amount of liquid that flows somewhere
in: the River Nile
They were swimming in the river.
river fishing
up river  (=in the direction that the river is flowing from): Up river, the water was clearer and deeper.
down river  (=in the direction that the river is flowing): We met them a couple of miles down river.
river of: Great rivers of molten lava poured from the volcano.

in the same direction as the flow of water in the river
water that flows naturally through a wide channel that is surrounded by land:
